snippet: The course’s recent restoration, which replaced the rough with coarse sand and native vegetation, has devalued course knowledge, and it has been suggested that the golfers with the least experience playing the course might fare the best.
abstract: Twelve American competitors at the United States Open, lead by Phil Mickelson, have participated in tournament the last two times it was held at Pinehurst, NC, in 1999 and 2005; some analysts say that course's recent restoration will favor those with the least experience, because they will play with a blank slate; other US Open news noted.

byline.original: By KAREN CROUSE and BILL PENNINGTON

lead_paragraph: The course’s recent restoration, which replaced the rough with coarse sand and native vegetation, has devalued course knowledge, and it has been suggested that the golfers with the least experience playing the course might fare the best.

headline.main: After Rough-Hewed Restoration, Experience at Pinehurst Is Devalued
